_header: Listeneth lordings both great and small
Subjects: Thomas of Canterbury, saint; carols, of saints
_description: Song in honour of St. Thomas of Canterbury — in quatrains (aaab) with Latin caudae and burden: A a a a / Nu[nc] gaudet ecclesia

OxfBal354.First Lines:
Lystyn lordyngis both gret & smallI will you tell a wonder
                    tale…
OxfBal354.Last Lines:
… & stered his braynes vp so downOptans celi
                    gawdiaExplicit
OxfBal354.Facsimiles:
Early Manuscripts at Oxford University: Facsimile
                    of Oxford, Balliol MS 354.
         (http://image.ox.ac.uk/show?collection=balliol&manuscript=ms354).

Dyboski,  R.,
                        ed.

EETS

Segar,  Mary Gertrude,  and  Emmeline Paxton, eds.

         London, NY: Longmans, Green, 1917:  19-20.

CamGon383.First Lines:
Herkennd lordingus grete & smaleyc wol ȝow telle awonder
                    tale…
CamGon383.Last Lines:
…for fyftene tokenus of gret strifContra regis
                    consilia
CamGon383.Note:
8 x 4 (this ms), aaab, plus burden: ‘A a a a nunc gaudet
                    ecclesia’; stanzas 1, 3, 2, 4-6, 8, 9

BLSl2593.First Lines:
Lestenytgh lordynges bothe grete & smaleI xal you telyn a
                    wonder tale…
BLSl2593.Last Lines:
…For lii poyntes he les his lyfContra regis
                    consilia
